alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rains have ended over the advisory area. However, 2 to 4 inches of rainfall has fallen over this area from the earlier thunderstorms. This amount of water will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory remains in effect until 5:30 PM EDT this evening for Southeastern Palm Beach County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boca Raton, Delray Beach, Highland Beach, Kings Point, Boca Del Mar, Fau South Campus and Boca West. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
